availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Alexander Harvey (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, bookkeeper and Captain (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier (U.S.A.). Tennessee native. Son of Alexander Harvey and Mary Porter Harvey. Married Hattie Herndon Harvey on August 20, 1860. Father of Lennie Harvey. Resident in Allen County, Kentucky in 1850. Served as Captain (U.S.A.) in 1863. Clerk to United States paymaster in Davidson County, Tennessee on October 18, 1864. Bookkeeper in Louisville, Kentucky in 1870.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Allen County, p. 216. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709, p. 9. _Birth and Death Records: Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1958 â€“ Roll 10, Deaths, p. 23288. KYR-0002-222-0044.
